required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-label, Randomised, Single-centre, 2-way Crossover Bioequivalence Study Comparing 2 Formulations of Imeglimin After Single Oral Doses in Healthy Caucasian Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label assessment of the bioequivalence of two 500 mg-tablet formulations of imeglimin (Tablet A [reference product] and Tablet B [test product]), in at least 16 healthy Caucasian volunteers.

primary_outcome.description: Cmax: peak plasma concentration after dosing

secondary_outcome.description: AUC last: area Under the concentration time curve

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events (Safety and tolerability)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events

arm_group.arm_group_label: Tablet A in Session 1 and Tablet B in Session 2
arm_group.description: Tablet A = reference product Tablet B = test product

arm_group.arm_group_label: Tablet B in Session 1 and Tablet A in Session 2
arm_group.description: Tablet A = reference product Tablet B = test product

intervention.arm_group_label: Tablet A in Session 1 and Tablet B in Session 2
Tablet B in Session 1 and Tablet A in Session 2
Tablet A in Session 1 and Tablet B in Session 2
Tablet B in Session 1 and Tablet A in Session 2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI : 18.5-29.9
- Body weight â‰¥ 60 kg
- willing to use reliable contraception
- able to give fully informed written consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Positive tests for hepatitis B & C, HIV
- severe adverse reaction to any drug; sensitivity to trial medication and/or food allergies
- drug or alcohol abuse
- smoking of more than 5 cigarettes daily or drinking more than 5 cups of caffeinated drinks daily
- over-the-counter medication, vitamins and herbal remedies, or prescribed medication in the 20 days before the first dose of trial medication (with the exception of paracetamol [acetaminophen] and oral contraception);
- participation in other clinical trials of unlicensed medicines, or loss of more than 400 mL blood, within the previous 3 months
- vital signs outside the acceptable range
- clinically relevant abnormal findings at the screening assessment; estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) at screening < 80 mL/min/1.73 m2
- acute or chronic illness
- clinically relevant abnormal medical history or concurrent medical condition;
- surgery or medical condition that might affect the absorption of medicines;
- possibility that volunteer will not cooperate
- pre-menopausal females who are pregnant or lactating, or who are sexually active and not using a reliable method of contraception;
- objection by the volunteer's General Practitioner (GP).
